member.name: T:Aspose.Chart.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.remarks: Use this class for licenses purchased after 2005/01/22 when Aspose upgraded its licensing system.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named Aspose.Word.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("Aspose.Word.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("Aspose.Word.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named Aspose.Word.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("Aspose.Word.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("Aspose.Word.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Use this method for licenses purchased after 2005/01/22 when Aspose upgraded its licensing system.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named Aspose.Word.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("Aspose.Word.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("Aspose.Word.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license. Use null to switch to evaluation mode.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.
Use this method for licenses purchased after 2005/01/22 when Aspose upgraded its licensing system.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttribute.GanttHeightRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the height rate for slices of a Gantt chart.
member.remarks: Valid for Gantt only. It can be between 0.0 and 1.0.The default value is 2/3.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttribute.BarWidthRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the width rate for slices of a Bar chart.
member.remarks: Valid for Bar only. It can be between 0.0 and 1.0. The default value is 2/3.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttribute.PointSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the point size.
member.remarks: Valid for Cube, Line(2D), Pareto(2D), Point, Radar, Scatter(3D) only. The default value is 6.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttribute.PointMarker
member.summary: Gets or sets the point marker type.
member.remarks: Valid for Line(2D), Pareto(2D), Point, Radar, Scatter(3D) only. The default value is Circle.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttribute.IsExploded
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates if a data point is exploded.
member.remarks: Valid for Pie and Doughnut only. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttribute.IsAllExploded
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates if all the data points are exploded.
member.remarks: Valid for Pie and Doughnut only. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttribute.ExplodedWidthRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the width rate of the exploded slice.
member.remarks: Valid for Pie and Doughnut only. It can be between 0.0 and 1.0 and the default value is 0.1.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttribute.IsWithLabelMark

member.summary: Gets or sets the bubble maximum size.
member.remarks: Valid for Bubble only. The default value is 50F.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.DataPoint.URL
member.summary: Gets or sets url value.
member.remarks:
When the URL target page is located in the same physical directory as the current page, you can specify the target file name only: DataPoint1.URL = "redirect.htm"
If you wish to jump to another domain, you should configure the full web address: DataPoint1.URL = "http://www.aspose.com"
Now, the url value only support flash image. If you set url, you must save the chart to flash file( .swf file ). And support Bar, Pie, Doughnut chart only now.

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.Chart.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Obsolete. Licenses this component to use in a Windows application.

remarks.p: Use this method for licenses purchased before 2005/01/22. Aspose has upgraded to a new licensing system, please use License. for licenses purchased after that date.

member.param: The license filename with its path.

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.Chart.SetLicense(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Obsolete. Licenses this component to use in a Windows application.

remarks.p: Use this method for licenses purchased before 2005/01/22. Aspose has upgraded to a new licensing system, please use License. for licenses purchased after that date.
Use this method when you use Al.exe to assemble the license file into your assembly.

member.example:
Please make sure to create licenseReader using UnicodeEncoding.UTF7:
[C#]
StreamReader licenseReader = new StreamReader(licenseFile, UnicodeEncoding.UTF7); Chart.SetLicense(licenseReader);
[Visual Basic]
Dim licenseReader As StreamReader = New StreamReader(licenseFile,UnicodeEncoding.UTF7) Chart.SetLicense(licenseReader)
member.param: Where to read the license from.

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.Chart.SetLicense(System.String,System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Obsolete. Licenses this component to use in a Web application.

remarks.p: Use this method for licenses purchased before 2005/01/22. Aspose has upgraded to a new licensing system, please use License. for licenses purchased after that date.

member.param: The license filename with its path.
The page that requests this object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.Chart.SetLicense(System.IO.TextReader,System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Obsolete. Licenses this component to use in a Web application.

remarks.p: Use this method for licenses purchased before 2005/01/22. Aspose has upgraded to a new licensing system, please use License. for licenses purchased after that date.
Use this method when you use Al.exe to assemble the license file into your assembly.

member.example:
Please make sure to create licenseReader using UnicodeEncoding.UTF7:
[C#]
StreamReader licenseReader = new StreamReader(licenseFile, UnicodeEncoding.UTF7); Chart.SetLicense(licenseReader, this);
[Visual Basic]
Dim licenseReader As StreamReader = New StreamReader(licenseFile, UnicodeEncoding.UTF7) Chart.SetLicense(licenseReader, Me)
member.param: Where to read the license from.
The page that requests this object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.Chart.GetTmpFileName(System.String,System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat)
member.summary: Gets a temporary file name for the chart image. The format of the image file can be any of , such as Bmp, Emf, Exif, Gif, Icon, Jpeg, Png, Tiff, Wmf, etc. The default format is Png.
member.remarks: Note that you are responsible for deleting the temporary file after you have finished with it.
member.param: The path where to save the temporary file.
member.returns: An image filename with full path.

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.Chart.Save(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates the chart and then saves it to an image file.
member.param: The image filename with full path.
The bool variable to indicate whether to delete the temporary image file before create a file. Generally, it should be true.

example.code:
[C#] mychart.Save( "C:\\mysale.jpg", true );
[Visual Basic] mychart.Save("C:\mysale.jpg",True)

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.Chart.SaveToSwf(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates the flash chart and saves it to a file.
member.param: The flash image filename with full path.
The bool variable to indicate whether to delete the temporary image file before create a file. Generally, it should be true.
member.remarks: The API use 32 bit Bitmap lossless image format to save chart image. But it will waste some time to compress the origin bitmap data. If your chart image is very large, the API will waste more time.

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.Chart.SaveToSwf(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates the flash chart and saves it to a file.
member.param: The flash image filename with full path.
if isJpegMode is true, the swf file will include jpeg format image, and the size of the swf file is small. If isJpegMode is false, the swf file will include 32 bit Bitmap format loseless image.
The bool variable to indicate whether to delete the temporary image file before create a file. Generally, it should be true.
